title: Benefits Specialist, EMEA
content:
Who we are
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies - from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups - use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone's reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
At Stripe, we’re constantly working on ways to optimize our benefits programs and improve the experience for our users. We are looking for a Benefits Specialist to join our International Benefits Team to focus on designing, scaling, and administering Stripe’s benefits programs as well as Stripe’s time off and leave administration in EMEA and beyond.
What you’ll do
In this role, you’ll also help the Benefits team maintain best-in-class benefits support to employees. Your work will be instrumental to Stripe achieving its mission by supporting every Stripe to take care of themselves and their loved ones, to build their best self, and to do their best work.
Responsibilities

 Administer employee benefit programs such as health and risk insurance, retirement plans, leave of absence, and disability programs 
Assist with benefits and leave of absence program design and implementation of new and existing programs
Assist with global benefits programs in EMEA
Help to maintain program renewals, vendor changes and new program expansion
Improve employee-facing benefits communications 
Provide a positive user experience as you answer questions and address issues for employees
Manage the completion of EMEA-specific compliance items
Work closely with partner teams from HR, Payroll, Legal, Mobility, Systems and People Operations to manage programs
Work closely with Stripe’s global benefits broker and local brokers in each country 
Oversee ongoing maintenance and enhancements of Workday Benefits and Time off modules
Participate in benefits surveys and benchmarking exercises in order to provide recommendations to maintain competitive benefits programs 
Make data based recommendations on plan provisions and design to ensure we offer cost effective and competitive benefits programs
Assist with benefits integrations for mergers and acquisitions
Help maintain the fidelity of our People data through auditing and entering data used during the employee lifecycle and helping our HRIS in maintaining job profiles, job families, and comp codes
Support and partner across the People team to process changes in Workday when Stripes are hired, change managers, cost centers, teams or locations, ensuring a high degree of accuracy
Assist all Stripes by responding to employment verifications and other people-related data requests
Create and maintain employee files, track annual trainings, review candidate documentation and manage background checks
Proactively seek and take initiative for process improvements and automation to assist in scaling the People Ops team

 
Who you are
We're looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. 
Minimum requirements

Minimum of 3-5+ years of experience administering benefits programs including health and risk insurance, retirement plans and leaves of absence across multiple regions. 
Experience with Workday Benefits and Absence modules
Intermediate to advanced Mac OS and Google suite skills (Gmail, Docs, Sheets, Slides)
Creativity and focus on process: you’re constantly looking for ways to make things work more efficiently
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with an appropriate blend of professionalism and friendliness
Strong Project Management skills 
Incredible organizational skills; superb attention to detail
Strong analytical skills, a proven ability to execute processes, and a flexible approach to problem-solving, even in the face of ambiguity
Discretion and judgment handling confidential and sensitive data
Ability to be a team player and excel at cross-functional collaboration; adept at working with multiple people at any given time
Ability to build and document programs and processes with an analytical eye
Ability to shift priorities based on the current business needs and to make progress in a timely manner on multiple, concurrent projects

Are you authorized to work in the location(s) you selected in your previous response?

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
questions.label: If this role offers the option to work from a remote location, do you plan to work remotely?

values.label: Yes, I intend to work remotely.
No, I intend to work from an office location.
